{"step_by_step_thinking": "Folic acid deficiency can be caused by several factors, including poor diet, certain illnesses, and some medications. Aspirin, Ranitidine, and Cyclosporin are not known to cause folic acid deficiency. However, Phenytoin, an anticonvulsant medication, can interfere with the body's ability to absorb folic acid, leading to a deficiency.", "answer_choice": "D. Phenytoin"}
